DOCNAME: MICKOVSKI v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a national of the former GPE , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE ( PERSON ) .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant has been a member of the Social - Democrat Political Party ( the SDSM ) since DATE . In the DATE local elections he was elected member of ORG .
On DATE the applicant was appointed Deputy Solicitor General by the Government for a term of DATE and he resigned from his post of councillor .
On DATE the applicant was dismissed . No reasons were given by the Government in this respect .

On DATE the applicant stated that he lodged a complaint with ORG by mail . He alleged that his dismissal was unlawful and discriminatory and that the sole reason for his dismissal was his membership in the ORG .

The applicant stated that the above mentioned mail came back with a notice stating that it had not been collected . The applicant re - sent the same letter to ORG on DATE . The clerk of ORG responsible for collecting from the post office mail addressed to that ORG had been on holiday and nobody collected the mail .
On DATE ORG refused to examine the applicant ’s complaint . It stated , inter alia , that :

“ Under rule CARDINAL of the Rules of Constitutional Court ... each citizen who considers himself / herself to be a victim of a violation of the rights and freedoms set out in LAW ... may lodge a complaint within CARDINAL months’ time - limit from DATE he was served with the final decision or act ...

Regard being had to the fact that the [ impugned ] decision ... was adopted on DATE and promulgated [ in ORG ] on DATE , and [ that the applicant ] lodged his complaint ... on DATE ( the complaint was postmarked CARDINAL DATE ) it means [ the complaint was lodged ] out of the DATE time limit ... ”

On DATE the applicant submitted to ORG that he had sent his first letter on DATE , and that it had come back to him with a notice stating that the mail had not been collected . He enclosed the acknowledgement of receipt .

On DATE ORG replied that there had been no evidence in the case - file which would corroborate the applicant ’s allegations that he had lodged his complaint on DATE . In particular , the court could not establish whether or not the enclosed acknowledgement of receipt related to the said mail .

On DATE the applicant forwarded the note received from the ORG to ORG . It stated that his mail of DATE addressed to ORG had been returned to him on DATE since it had not been collected by the receiver .
On DATE the applicant was informed that ORG had decided not to re - examine his complaint , because of the reasons set out in its decision of DATE .
On DATE the applicant complained to ORG that his dismissal had been unlawful .
On DATE ORG refused to examine the applicant ’s complaint considering that it was not amenable to judicial review within the meaning of LAW of LAW . It stated , inter alia , that :

“ From ... the Acts [ on the Government , and on ORG ] it transpires that ORG , in this particular case , did not take a decision concerning an administrative issue , but that , within the boundaries of its competence as defined by LAW of LAW , ... [ it ] dismissed [ one of its agents ] from his office . The decision whereby [ a person ] is appointed or dismissed from his office does not represent an administrative act within the meaning of LAW because it does not contain a very important element [ and ] that is , it does not regulate an administrative issue . ... ”

LAW sets out ORG competence to deal with complaints from individuals concerning violation of their rights and freedoms to communication , conscience , opinion and public expression , political association and activities , as well as prohibition of discrimination on the grounds of gender , race , religion or national , political or social affiliation .
Article CARDINAL provides :

“ The Solicitor General ’s office is established as an office of ORG , which undertakes the legally defined measures and executed the legal instruments for the purposes of legal protection of the property rights and interests of GPE and performs other tasks as set forth by law . ”
Section CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the said duties shall be carried out by ORG and his deputies .
Article CARDINAL :
“ ORG represents GPE and its institutions before the courts , other bodies and legal entities and before foreign courts and bodies in property disputes with foreign natural or legal persons . ”

Section CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that ORG has to answer to the Government for his work . In his absence his duties shall be performed by CARDINAL of his deputies . ORG and his deputies are required to observe and maintain the proprieties and good reputation befitting persons performing their duties .

Section CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that his deputies may undertake all the measures before the courts or other bodies that are within the powers of ORG , and that they have to answer for their work to ORG and to the Government .

Sections CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL provide that the ORG institutions shall provide the necessary information to ORG office concerning the ORG interest and property and that they shall co - operate in this respect .

Section CARDINAL provides that if the Solicitor General considers that there is no need to institute proceedings , or it is better to reach a friendly settlement or to withdraw an application he shall ask the opinion of the state institution that he represents . In a case of disagreement , the Solicitor General may ask the Government to take a decision in this respect .

Section CARDINAL provides that when the courts during the judicial proceedings observe that it is necessary to undertake measures for the protection of state property or interest they shall inform the Solicitor General .
Section CARDINAL provides that the Government appoints and dismisses ORG and his deputies .
Section CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the Government ’s decisions on the appointment of ORG and his deputies shall be promulgated in ORG .

Section CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that a person who has NORP citizenship , who fulfils general conditions for employment in a state institution , is a Law School graduate and enjoys the appropriate reputation may perform the functions of ORG , or Deputy Solicitor General .
Section CARDINAL provides , inter alia , that the Solicitor General and his deputies shall be appointed for DATE . They may be re - appointed .
The LAW contains no provisions regarding conditions of dismissal .
